cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest across the Yucatan Channel, then north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Vermilion Bay/Cameron-Morgan City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches confined to portions of western Cuba; none along the Texas coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm warnings in effect for the northeastern Yucatan Peninsula; none along the U.S. Gulf Coast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impact expected from southeast Texas waters eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (20%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds Friday; peak gusts could reach 35–45 mph in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor rise in water levels (generally <2 ft) possible due to long-period swells; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of showers could bring 1–3 inches of rain Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast beginning late Thursday.
